message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the fundamental network capacity of a multi-user wireless downlink, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and networking (cs.NI). The use of Markov chains and decision problems suggests a systems and control (cs.SY) perspective. The paper also proposes a queue-dependent policy, which involves optimization and machine learning (cs.LG), and uses a Lyapunov drift argument, which is a common tool in control theory and optimization. Finally, the paper uses stochastic coupling and state aggregation, which are techniques commonly used in multi-armed bandit problems (cs.MA).
